comment: I took Dr. Boshears in Spring 2018 for gen ed. What I liked about his class was it had a clear structure and grading guidelines. What I disliked was his tendency to go off topic and ramble. he is a good guy and he is pretty funny, you can tell he cares about his students, but he needs to be more concise. He is definately a good choice for a gen ed
A solid choice, friendly and helpful.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: This class was an easy A, and it was enjoyable because Dr. Boshears is a nice man. He cares about his students, and he wants you to succeed. Definitely worth taking.

Very nice guy, and he cares about his students. He can be a bit disorganized in his lectures, but he is very funny and makes the material interesting. As long as you show up to class and do the readings you will make As. Definitely worth taking.

If you have the opportunity to take Professor Boshear's class, DO IT. I was very unexcited about taking a philosophy class, but he is a great lecturer & he'll explain something 100 different ways if you ask, just to make sure you understand it. He really cares. Attend class, take notes, read books & you'll do fine, kid. I promise its actually fun.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Caring

comment: Nice prof. 4 Pop quizzes throughout the semester. A midterm and final based on questions that he gives you. Literally same questions he gives you in class as objectives are on the midterm and final (noncumulative) which i loved cus i hate cumulative . Not a super hard class, but a lot of reading that is manageable. Required discussion posts online.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: He is a nice guy but is lecture heavy. Midterm and final are based on the learning objectives which you have to listen for the answers in his lectures. A few extra assignments but easy to do. LOTS OF READING!!! if you do not read you will fail the pop quizzes! Most lectures were boring but I did find some interesting

This guy cares about what he teaches, but to be frank, he is not gifted at explaining philosophical ideas. He often cut himself off mid-sentence to jump to a new thought and began explanations with examples before defining his terms. Would not take again. However, he does care for his students and wants them to succeed. Offers extra credit & help.

comment: He is one of my favorite teachers I have ever had. If you read the books he gives you and take notes during the lectures, you will get an A. He is caring, and he respects his students. He is hilarious, and his humor is the only reason I was able to pay attention during his 8AM. Just show up to class, do your work, and don't be rude during class.

If you do all the work, its an easy A, just go to class and read. Midterm and final straight from notes, but I still wouldn't take him again. He's nice, but VERY egotistical, which made me HATE coming to class (and attendance directly effects your grade).
